keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez and Nick Madigan contributed reporting from Miami, and Karen Schwartz from Fort Collins, Colo.

lead_paragraph: At least 14 cases of the virus been found in the Wynwood neighborhood in Miami and have been spread by local mosquitoes there.

headline.print_headline: A Travel Warning for Miami as Zika Cases Rise
headline.main: Zika Surge in Miami Neighborhood Prompts Travel Warning

snippet: At least 14 cases of the virus been found in the Wynwood neighborhood in Miami and have been spread by local mosquitoes there....
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention are urging pregnant women to steer clear of Wynwood neighborhood of Miami where several cases of Zika infection have been discovered, casting doubt over effectiveness of mosquito-control efforts in Florida and raising questions about tourism there; mosquito experts say Aedes aegypti mosquito, which transmits Zika virus, thrives in tiny pockets of water, and may be resistant to insecticides being used.
